food animal drug safety
drug residue
American Academy of Veterinary Pharmacology and Therapeutics
AAVPT
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Sixth Biennial Symposium of the American Academy of Veterinary Pharmacology and Therapeutics (AAVPT), held June 13-16 at Blacksburg, Virginia, was dedicated to Dr. Lloyd E. Davis, professor of veterinary pharmacology and clinical medicine at the University of Illinois College of Veterinary Medicine at Urbana. Dr. Davis was honored for his numerous contributions to AAVPT and to the discipline of veterinary and comparative pharmacology. The symposium, which attracted veterinary pharmacologists from across the North America and from Europe, addressed contemporary issues of animal drugs and food safety. Sessions explored the impact of animal drugs on food safety and quality, analytical methodologies for residue detection, and considerations related to the teaching of veterinary and comparative pharmacology in the future.
